Description: Great playing and sounding Les Paul. Gibson should use these when crafting their Gibson line. Tunes perfectly with zero intonation problems . This is a dark back Gold top I would estimate the weight in the 8-9 lb area. I have tried to do the best in photographing the blemishes . There are zero issues with this guitar . I would recommend putting in Gibson Burst buckers and maybe a wiring harness with bumblebee caps and you would have a guitar worth 4K or more for 1/4 the price. You would have a really nice Gold top while saving yourself a fortune. The neck isn’t the fattest or the thinnest but I would put it on the compfotably thin side. These are solid guitars and are better than many Gibson’s I’ve owned. Way better in some cases . If it said Gibson on the headstock it would be an honor to that product line. The action is low with no buzz and currently strung with 10-46. I believe it’s production is June 96 . I’m not the original owner and I picked this one up to bring into atmospheres that would afford me some piece of mind without worrying about an accident ....too much. I haven’t added any scratches that weren’t there when I bought it a few years back. This is a very satisfying guitar to play and will probably make you question why you would ever spend more money just for a name. Very impressive in so many ways but I’m no longer using this instrument so it just sits waiting for the next part of its journey to begin. I anticipate shipping to cost about $130 for professional job so shipping will be set at $100 for USA. No international buyers unless you have a shipping service or export company with a USA address I can ship to. I will not be shipping internationally .
Title: orville les paul standard Gold top
